agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A not-for-profit, county-owned, regional medical center serving people in Cass County and north central Indiana.
service_description: Provides primary medical care for adults, adolescents, and children. Medical care includes treatment for minor illnesses and injuries, regular wellness checkups, and other basic medical services.
site_details: Walk-ins accepted; appointments are preferred.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides pregnancy counseling and support from a pro-life perspective, maternity and baby clothing, referrals to prenatal care, adoption resources, and other abortion alternatives.
service_description: Provides free, gently used maternity and baby clothing (up to size 2T) all women in need.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to see availability.
site_eligibility: Expectant mothers -- Women with children under 2 years old
Pregnant women in need of services

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Carroll County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Carroll County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. (Offers sandbags to Carroll County households during times of flooding.)
site_details: Call for information. -- For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.

site_schedule.name: County Offices of Emergency Services
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Disaster Relief/Recovery Organizations
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Emergency Preparedness and Response Planning
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Sandbags/Water Diversion Systems
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: General Disaster Information
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Carroll County
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County
Living in Carroll County -- Age 19 or older

Living in Carroll County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Living in Carroll County
Living in Carroll County -- Age 6 months and older
Varies by service; call for details.
Age 18 and older

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Delphi in Carroll County. Persons in need of emergency assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Carroll County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including financial assistance.
service_description: Offers limited financial assistance for utilities (electric, gas, or water), rent, and food vouchers for those in need.  Assistance is determined on a case-by-case basis and is dependent on funding.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. -- A two-page application is required.
site_eligibility: Living in Carroll County -- Not received assistance from this program within the past 6 months

agency_desc: Provides services for Carroll County seniors, including transportation and social activities.
service_description: Offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, weekly lunches, foot care information, daily care calling, travel, and field trips.
site_details: Call for information; monthly activity calendar published in local newspaper.
site_eligibility: Age 55 and older
Age 50 and older -- Persons with disabilities
Open

agency_name: DEER CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - CARROLL COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: DEER CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - CARROLL COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
Varies by service; serves Carroll County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Carroll County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Petition Filing Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-5pm; Wed 8am-noon

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-5pm; Wed 8am-noon

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-5pm; Wed 8am-noon

site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance:   Living in Carroll County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child
Varies by service

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Walk in.

site_schedule.name: Veteran Benefits Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, and Thurs 8am-noon and 1pm-5pm; Wed 8am-noon; Fri by appointment

site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Carroll County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Carroll County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-5pm; Wed 8am-noon -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-5pm; Wed 8am-noon -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Flora.
service_description: Issues pet licenses in the town of Flora in Carroll County. By town ordinance, Flora pet owners must have a current animal license and rabies vaccination tag for any dog or cat age 6 months of age or older. Licenses must be renewed annually.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in the town of Flora -- Dogs or Cats 6 months or older
Varies by service; services limited to properties within Flora town limits
Open; serves the town of Flora
Open; serves the towns of Bringhurst and Flora

agency_desc: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and internet access.
service_description: Offers delivery of requested library materials to home-bound persons in the town of Flora or in Monroe Township.
site_details: Call to request delivery.

site_schedule.name: Home Library Services
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 10am-5:30pm; Tues and Thurs 10am-7:30pm; Sat 10am-2pm

site_schedule.name: Public Internet Access Sites
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 10am-5:30pm; Tues and Thurs 10am-7:30pm; Sat 10am-2pm

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 10am-5:30pm; Tues and Thurs 10am-7:30pm; Sat 10am-2pm

site_eligibility: Living in the town of Flora or in Monroe Township. -- Home-bound due to chronic or extended illness or physical disability
Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in the town of Flora or in Monroe Township in Carroll County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Burlington Township, or Cutler, Deer Creek, Carrollton, and Bringhurst.

agency_desc: Provides electric service for customers within service area.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in portions of Benton, Carroll, Cass, Clinton, Howard, Jasper, Pulaski, Tippecanoe and White counties.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a payment drop-box is available at this location.

site_schedule.name: Electric Service Providers
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4:30pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open (12 and under must have parent present, 12 and over must have a permission form signed by a parent) -- For a library card: Open

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Carroll County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Carroll County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Carroll County)

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $10,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.

site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Carroll County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Carroll County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed
Age 17 or younger
Offenders assigned to probation by the Carroll County Courts
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
service_description: Provides classes on recognizing and changing patterns of problematic or abusive behavior for men and women who use violence or other abusive behavior in relationships. Participants may self-refer, be court-ordered, or referred by the Department of Child Services (DCS). This 26-week program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV). Clients may begin the program at any time.
site_details: Call to schedule orientation. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)
site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization animal rescue team that offers adoption and foster care for animals in Carroll County.
service_description: Provides foster homes for stray and unwanted animals in Carroll County and rehomes animals through adoption.
site_details: Call or email for more information about adopting or fostering animals.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing a variety of mental health services, including a crisis line, inpatient and outpatient services, and substance abuse services.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, couples, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, and home- and community-based services are available to eligible clients receiving treatment at this center.
taxonomy_name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_details: Call for information or to a schedule an appointment. -- Walk in for emergency assessment or crisis intervention.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides household recycling and hazardous waste collection and education and information about recycling, reusing, and reducing environmental hazards.
site_name: NORTHWEST INDIANA SOLID WASTE DISTRICT - CARROLL COUNTY
service_description: Maintains drop-off sites for collecting recyclables including:  corrugated cardboard and box board, newspaper, magazines,  steel and aluminum cans, office paper, fluorescent lights, motor oil, batteries, electronics, appliances, tires, and number one and two plastics.
site_details: Walk in, email, call, or visit the website for information.

site_schedule.name: Recycling Centers
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs and Fri 9am-4pm, Sat 9am-noon -- Drop Off: Varies by site

site_schedule.name: Specialized Information and Referral
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs and Fri 9am-4pm, Sat 9am-noon -- Drop Off: Varies by site

site_eligibility: Residential households in the county

agency_desc: A division of Purdue University offering nurse-managed community clinics.
service_description: Provides health education and primary care services to patients of all ages. Available services include routine exams, health screenings, diagnosis and treatment of minor and chronic health conditions, treatment of minor injuries and illnesses, flu vaccinations, immunizations, gynecological care, limited prenatal care, CDL/DOT physicals and physicals for school, sports, or work. Care is provided by Advance Practice Nurses in collaboration with area physicians or specialists
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or to apply for financial assistance.
site_eligibility: For Clinic: Open -- For Sliding-scale Fees: Uninsured -- Household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level

For Information and Assistance: Open -- For Marketplace Enrollment: Household income at least 100% Federal Poverty Level (for subsidy, household income must be between 100%-400% FPL) -- US citizen or legal resident -- Not currently incarcerated

agency_desc: A division of Purdue University offering nurse-managed community clinics.
service_description: Provides telephone and in-person information and enrollment assistance for plans in the Health Insurance Marketplace established by the Affordable Care Act. The Open Enrollment period for the Health Insurance Marketplace is November 1 to December 15. Enrollment assistance for Medicaid including Healthy Indiana Plan. SHIP Medicare counseling for Medicare recipients. All Navigator services are free of charge.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or to obtain information about the Health Insurance Marketplace.
site_eligibility: For Information and Assistance: Open -- For Marketplace Enrollment: Household income at least 100% Federal Poverty Level (for subsidy, household income must be between 100%-400% FPL) -- US citizen or legal resident -- Not currently incarcerated
For Clinic: Open -- For Sliding-scale Fees: Uninsured -- Household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing food and basic necessities to those in need.
service_description: Provides a three day supply of perishable and nonperishable food based upon the size of the family. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Carroll County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing food and basic necessities to those in need.
service_description: Provides a three day supply of perishable and nonperishable food based upon the size of the family. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Carroll County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a clothing pantry.
service_description: Provides free clothing, shoes, coats, bedding, dishes, towels, and other household small items for people in need. Baby through adult sizes are generally available. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open
